title: Software Engineer
description:
**Number of Job Posts** 
 : 12
 



  





**Company Description** 




  





 Seceon Inc. provides a next\\-generation AI\\-powered cybersecurity platform designed for enterprises, MSPs, and MSSPs to detect, respond to, and mitigate threats in real\\-time, eliminating the need for multiple security tools. The platform unifies SIEM, SOAR, UEBA, EDR, NDR, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, and Compliance features into one seamless solution. Seceon's cutting\\-edge technology leverages machine learning, artificial intelligence, and dynamic threat models to ensure rapid threat identification and automated remediation. Scalable and multi\\-tenant, the platform supports millions of events per second, offering comprehensive visibility and streamlined compliance with industry regulations. Trusted by organizations seeking faster threat resolutions, increased efficiency, and reduced cybersecurity costs.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a full\\-time remote role for a Software Engineer. The Software Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and deploying high\\-quality software solutions. Day\\-to\\-day tasks include back\\-end development, implementing efficient programming solutions, and working with teams to ensure high\\-performance system functionality. The role will focus on creating scalable, secure, and reliable software to support cutting\\-edge cybersecurity technologies.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Strong foundation in Computer Science principles
* Proficiency in Back\\-End Web Development and Software Development
* Expertise in Programming and experience in Object\\-Oriented Programming (OOP)
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and remotely
* Strong problem\\-solving skills with attention to detail and a drive to deliver innovative solutions
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
* Experience in the cybersecurity or technology industry is a plus
* Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a bonus



  





 Visit: https://seceon.com/careers/

title: STAFF ENGINEER
description:
At OakNorth, we‚Äôre on a mission to empower the UK‚Äôs most ambitious businesses. Since 2015, Since 2015, we‚Äôve lent over $21bn across the UK and US, helped create more than 58,000 new homes and 36,000 jobs, and supported hundreds of thousands of personal savers ‚Äî all while operating in one of the most highly regulated environments in financial services.
   

  

 OakNorth is a profitable business that has supported the growth of thousands of entrepreneurs with a new standard of business lending. We're looking for people to join our Engineering team in building upon this success, as we grow to play a key part in redefining the future of business banking with next generation financial tools and products.
   

  

 This is a fantastic opportunity to join a fast\\-paced, growing bank with a reputation for doing things differently. We don‚Äôt want another cog in the machine, we‚Äôre looking for self\\-starters and bold thinkers who want to pave their own career paths.
   

  

**The role üëã**
* As a Staff Engineer, you‚Äôll work with product and engineering across multiple squads to ensure the right technical and business trade\\-offs are made, dependencies are managed proactively, and execution remains predictable. Staff Engineers are among the most visible engineers in the organisation: they demonstrate technical excellence and our cultural values, influence decisions across squads, and raise the engineering bar through guidance, systems thinking, and hands\\-on contribution.
* Staff Engineers are not people managers by default, but they lead through influence, clarity, and technical credibility.
* Drive cross\\-squad technical outcomes: shape solutions for ambiguous, complex problems and guide squads toward sensible architectural decisions.
* Own technical decision\\-making mechanisms: write and steward RFCs/ADRs, run design reviews, document trade\\-offs, and ensure decisions are understood and adopted.
* Manage dependencies and execution risks: map dependencies, surface risks early, propose mitigation options, and keep stakeholders aligned as plans evolve.
* Communicate proactively and clearly: provide regular written updates on progress, risks, and changes in outlook; maintain a shared source of truth for key initiatives.
* Measure success by business impact: optimise for customer outcomes, reliability, and sustainable delivery‚Äînot lines of code.
* Raise quality and engineering standards: set expectations for code health, testing strategy, performance, resiliency, and production readiness across squads.
* Embrace DevOps culture (‚Äúyou build it, you run it‚Äù): improve operability, observability, incident response, and root\\-cause elimination; reduce operational toil and repeat issues.
* Build secure and resilient systems by design: partner early with Cyber/Risk to embed security and compliance considerations into architecture and delivery.
* Multiply others: coach and mentor engineers, help leads level up planning and technical direction, and grow decision\\-making depth across the org.
* Continuously improve platforms and developer experience: reduce duplication, strengthen shared abstractions, and improve tooling to enable faster, safer delivery across teams.


**Required Experience And Qualities**
* Strong technical background with 12\\+ years designing and engineering large\\-scale systems.
* Proven ability to lead architectural decisions on complex systems with multiple stakeholders and constraints.
* Strong judgement: prefer simple, maintainable solutions over unnecessary complexity.
* Comfortable operating in ambiguity and organised amidst chaos‚Äîcan bring clarity and structure when things are messy.
* Excellent collaboration and stakeholder management; able to earn trust across levels and functions.
* Broad systems thinker with the ability to anticipate downstream impacts across the wider business and technology ecosystem.
* Willing to challenge constructively, debate options, and then commit to the chosen path (‚Äúdisagree and commit‚Äù).


**Technology üß±**
* We're pragmatic about our technology choices. These are some of the things we use at the moment:
* üóÉ Python
* üóÑÔ∏è PostgreSQL, BigQuery, MySQL
* üé® TypeScript, React, styled\\-components
* üîß Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, pytest
* ‚òÅÔ∏è AWS, GCP
* üöÄ ECS Fargate, Docker, Terraform, GitHub Actions


**How We Expect You To Work üë∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è**
* We expect you to work in these ways, as well as encouraging and enabling these practices from others:
* Collaborate üí¨ \\- We work in cross\\-functional, mission driven, autonomous squads that gel over time. We pair program to work better through shared experience and knowledge.
* Focus on outcomes over outputs ‚úÖ \\- Solving a problem for users that translates to business results is our goal. Measurements focused on that goal help us to understand if we are succeeding.
* Practice continuous improvement üí° \\- We optimise for feedback now, rather than presume what might be needed in the future and introduce complexity before it will be used. This means we learn faster. We share learnings in blame\\-free formats, so that we do not repeat things that have failed, but still have confidence to innovate.
* Seek to understand our users üëÇ \\- We constantly seek understanding from data and conversations to better serve our users' needs, taking an active part in research to hear from them directly and regularly.
* Embrace and enable continuous deployment ü§ñ \\- Seamless delivery of changes into an environment \\- without manual intervention \\- is essential for us to ensure that we are highly productive; consider resiliency; and practice security by design.
* Test outside\\-in, test first üö¶ \\- TDD keeps us confident in moving fast, and deploying regularly. We want to solve user problems, and so we test with that mindset \\- writing scenarios first, then considering our solution; coupling tests to behaviour, rather than implementation.
* You build it, you run it ‚öôÔ∏è \\- We embrace DevOps culture and end\\-to\\-end ownership of products and features. Every engineer, regardless of their role, has the opportunity to lead delivery of features from start to finish.
* Be cloud native ‚òÅÔ∏è \\- We leverage automation and hosted services to deliver resilient, secure services quickly and consistently. Where SaaS tools help us achieve more productivity and better quality results for a cheap price, we use these to automate low value tasks.


**How We Expect You To Behave ‚ù§Ô∏è**
* We embrace difference and know that when we can be ourselves at work, we are happier, more motivated, and creative. We want to be able to bring our whole selves to work, have our own perspectives and know that we belong. As such, through your behaviours at work, we expect you to reflect and actively sustain a healthy engineering environment that looks like this:
* A wide range of voices heard to the benefit of all
* Teams that are clearly happy, engaged, and laugh together
* Perceivable safety to have an opinion or ask a question‚ÄØNo egos \\- people listen to and learn from others at all levels, with strong opinions held loosely


**Benefits \\& Perks üòç**
* Equity. We want people to have a stake in the business so that all our interests are aligned.
* Health Insurance for employee and dependents.
* Wellbeing and social events
* Support causes that matter to you ‚Äì Volunteering time off


**About Us**
 We‚Äôre OakNorth Bank and we embolden entrepreneurs to realise their ambitions, understand their markets, and apply data intelligence to everyday decisions to scale successfully at pace.
   

  

 Banking should be barrier\\-free. It‚Äôs a belief at our very core, inspired by our entrepreneurial spirit, driven by the unmet financial needs of millions, and delivered by our data\\-driven tools.
   

  

 And for those who love helping businesses thrive? Our savings accounts help diversify the high street and create new jobs, all while earning savers some of the highest interest on the market.
   

  

 But we go beyond finance, to empower our people, encourage professional growth and create an environment where everyone can thrive. We strive to create an inclusive and diverse workplace where people can be themselves and succeed.
   

  

*Our story*
 OakNorth Bank was built on the foundations of frustrations with old\\-school banking. In 2005, when our founders tried to get capital for their data analytics company, the computer said ‚Äòno‚Äô. Unfortunately, all major banks in the UK were using the same computer ‚Äì and it was broken.
   

  

 Why was it so difficult for a profitable business with impressive cashflow, retained clients, and clear commercial success to get a loan?
   

  

 The industry was backward\\-looking and too focused on historic financials, rather than future potential.
   

  

 So, what if there was a bank, founded by entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs? One that offered a dramatically better borrowing experience for businesses?
   

  

 No more what ifs, OakNorth Bank exists.
   

  

 For more information regarding our Privacy Policy and practices, please visit: https://oaknorth.co.uk/legal/privacy\\-notice/employees\\-and\\-visitors/

title: STAFF ENGINEER
description:

Since 2015, Since 2015, we‚Äôve lent over $21bn across the UK and US, helped create more than 58,000 new homes and 36,000 jobs, and supported hundreds of thousands of personal savers ‚Äî all while operating in one of the most highly regulated environments in financial services.
   

  

 OakNorth is a profitable business that has supported the growth of thousands of entrepreneurs with a new standard of business lending. We're looking for people to join our Engineering team in building upon this success, as we grow to play a key part in redefining the future of business banking with next generation financial tools and products.
   

  

 This is a fantastic opportunity to join a fast\\-paced, growing bank with a reputation for doing things differently. We don‚Äôt want another cog in the machine, we‚Äôre looking for self\\-starters and bold thinkers who want to pave their own career paths.

title: InterSystems IRIS Developer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** 




  





**Job Title: Senior Software Developer (Interoperability)** 




  





 Job Description:
 



 We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Developer with a focus on interoperability solutions. In this role, you will design, develop, and implement software systems using Intersystem product that facilitate seamless communication and data exchange between disparate systems. You will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to ensure the successful integration of technologies, improving efficiency and user experience for our EHR systems, you will also play a critical role in enhancing our software capabilities and ensuring high\\-quality integration standards.
 



**Required Qualifications** 




 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
 



 5\\+ years of software development experience, with a focus on interoperability solutions
 



 Familiarity with integration platforms and middleware solutions, Proficiency in Intersystem products (e.g., HealthShare, Ensemble, IRIS) and experience in implementing interoperability solutions is preferred
 



 Experience with RESTful APIs, SOAP, and JSON/XML data formats.
 



 Good knowledge of healthcare data standards (HL7, FHIR, DICOM, etc.)
 



 Key Responsibilities:
 



 Design and Development a robust, scalable, and efficient software solutions utilizing Intersystem technologies, such as HealthShare, Ensemble, or IRIS.
 



 Develop and implement interoperability frameworks that support data exchange and communication between disparate healthcare systems and applications.
 



 Work closely with cross\\-functional teams, including product management, and quality assurance, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
 



 Design integration architectures using HL7, FHIR, or other relevant standards to ensure compliance and best practices in data exchange.
 



 Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and share constructive feedback with team members
 



 Provide expert\\-level support for deployed applications, troubleshoot issues, and implement enhancements as needed.
 



 Maintain comprehensive documentation of integration processes, system configurations, and project specifications
 



 Conduct rigorous testing of interoperability solutions to ensure reliability, security, and performance
 



 Keep abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends related to interoperability and software development

title: Canary AI Fellowship Program 2026
description:
We are launching the flagship
 **Canary AI Fellowship Program** 
 , a selective research and industry training initiative designed to build the next generation of AI, consulting, and technology professionals.
 



 This is NOT a traditional internship or classroom program.
 



 It is a performance\\-driven fellowship aligned with real consulting and AI projects at Canary AI.
 



 üî¨ Fellowship Tracks:
 



 ‚Ä¢ AI \\& Machine Learning Research
 



 ‚Ä¢ Consulting \\& Strategy Analytics
 



 ‚Ä¢ Product \\& Automation Systems
 



 ‚Ä¢ Applied AI Development (LLMs, Agents, Automation)
 



 üéØ Who Should Apply:
 



 ‚Ä¢ Highly motivated students (UG/PG) in Tech, Management, or Analytics
 



 ‚Ä¢ Self\\-driven learners with strong problem\\-solving mindset
 



 ‚Ä¢ Candidates serious about research, consulting, and real\\-world execution
 



 ‚Ä¢ Not looking for passive training ‚Äî but active contribution
 



 üèÖ Fellowship Structure:
 



 ‚Ä¢ Selective Intake (Limited Seats)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Self\\-Sponsored Fellowship Track (‚Çπ1,00,000 program fee)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Merit\\-Based Sponsored Fellowships (for exceptional candidates)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Performance\\-Based Progression to Paid Roles (Top Performers)
 



 üíº What Fellows Will Get:
 



 ‚Ä¢ Direct exposure to real consulting and AI projects
 



 ‚Ä¢ Research\\-oriented mentorship
 



 ‚Ä¢ Portfolio development with live industry work
 



 ‚Ä¢ Potential stipend and full\\-time opportunities for top fellows
 



 ‚Ä¢ Official Fellowship Certification from Canary AI
 



 üìä Selection Process:
 


1. Application Screening
2. Technical / Analytical Assessment
3. Final Interaction with Leadership Team



 ‚ö†Ô∏è Important:
 



 This is a rigorous, research\\-oriented fellowship ‚Äî not a generic training program. Only serious and high\\-potential candidates are encouraged to apply.

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Software Development Intern (Remote)
 



  





 Company: Inficore Soft
 



 Location: Remote
 



 Employment Type: Full\\-time Internship
 



 Duration: 1‚Äì3 Months
 



 Stipend: ‚Çπ16,300 per month
 



  





 About Us
 



  





 At Inficore Soft, we are passionate about building innovative software solutions that empower businesses and individuals. We believe in nurturing talent, encouraging creativity, and providing real\\-world exposure to aspiring professionals.
 



  





 Internship Overview
 



  





 We are looking for enthusiastic and motivated Software Development Interns to join our team. This internship is designed to give you hands\\-on experience in coding, application development, and working with modern technologies while contributing to impactful projects.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 



  





 \\* Assist in designing, developing, and testing software applications.
 



 \\* Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
 



 \\* Debug and troubleshoot issues in existing codebases.
 



 \\* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to deliver project requirements.
 



 \\* Document processes and contribute to technical improvements.
 



  





  





 Qualifications
 



  





 \\* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree/diploma in Computer Science, IT, or related fields.
 



 \\* Strong knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Python, or C\\+\\+.
 



 \\* Familiarity with software development lifecycle and methodologies.
 



 \\* Good problem\\-solving and analytical skills.
 



 \\* Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
 



  





  





 What We Offer
 



  





 \\* Practical exposure to real\\-world software development projects.
 



 \\* Mentorship from experienced professionals.
 



 \\* Certificate of completion at the end of the internship.
 



 \\* Monthly stipend of ‚Çπ16,300\\.
 



 \\* Flexible remote work environment.
 



  





  





 Why Join Us?
 



  





 This internship is a stepping stone to your professional career. You‚Äôll gain practical exposure, enhance your software development skills, and build a strong foundation for future opportunities.
